From this information, it can be inferred that the increased cell count is likely benign. The next step would be to look at the image provided, which shows an increase in eosinophils. Eosinophils are a type of white blood cell. They play a role in allergic reactions and parasite infections. In normal conditions, they make up around 1-4% of the total leucocyte count. Since the patient has no complaints and the physical examination is normal, it can be concluded that the increased eosinophil count is likely related to an underlying condition rather than a disease.
